source.806a08b7:
train_data = pd.read_csv('../input/titanic-create-folds/TITANIC_Folds.csv') # Read TITANIC_Folds as train_data
test_data = pd.read_csv("../input/titanic/test.csv")
source.8290a3bc:
train_data.drop('Cabin',axis= 1,inplace= True)
test_data.drop('Cabin',axis= 1,inplace= True)
train_data['Age'] = train_data['Age'].fillna(int(train_data['Age'].mean()))
test_data['Age'] = test_data['Age'].fillna(int(test_data['Age'].mean()))
train_data['Embarked'] = train_data['Embarked'].fillna(train_data['Embarked'].mode()[0])
test_data['Fare'] = test_data['Fare'].fillna(test_data['Fare'].median())

train_data.drop('Ticket',axis= 1,inplace= True)
test_data.drop('Ticket',axis= 1,inplace= True)
train_data['Family_size']=train_data.SibSp + train_data.Parch + 1
test_data['Family_size']=test_data.SibSp + test_data.Parch + 1
train_data['IsAlone'] = 1
train_data[['IsAlone']][train_data.Family_size >1] = 0
test_data['IsAlone'] = 1
test_data[['IsAlone']][test_data.Family_size >1] = 0
#-----------------------------------------------
train_data['isTrain'] = 1
test_data['isTrain'] = 0
tt = pd.concat([train_data,test_data])
tt['Title']= tt.Name.apply(lambda x: x.split(',')[1].split('.')[0])
stat_min = 10
title_names = (tt['Title'].value_counts() >= stat_min)
t=title_names.reset_index()# most common titles
most_freq_titles = list(t[t.Title == True]['index'])
tt['Title']= tt.Title.apply(lambda x: x if x in most_freq_titles else 'other')
tt= pd.get_dummies(data= tt,columns=['Title'],drop_first= True)
tt['Fare_bins']=pd.qcut(tt.Fare, 4)
tt['Age_bins']= pd.cut(tt.Age.astype(int), 5)

label = LabelEncoder()
for rows in ['Age_bins','Fare_bins']:
    tt[rows]=label.fit_transform(tt[rows])

tt.drop(['Name','Fare','Age'],axis=1,inplace=True) # we have created 'Title' , 'Fare_bins', 'Age_bins' 
tt = pd.get_dummies(tt,columns= ['Sex','Embarked'],drop_first = True)
train_data = tt[tt.isTrain == 1]
test_data = tt[tt.isTrain == 0]
test_data.drop(['Survived','isTrain','fold'],axis=1,inplace = True)
train_data.drop(['isTrain'],axis=1,inplace= True)

# Note don't drop PassengerId column of train_data and test_data as it is used later. Instead drop it only for test and my_folds
useful_features = test_data.drop('PassengerId',axis=1).columns.tolist() #########################################
test = test_data[useful_features]
my_folds = train_data.copy()
source.6701adf9:
def obj(trial,xtrain,ytrain,xvalid,yvalid):
    
    params = {
        'leaf_size': trial.suggest_categorical('leaf_size',[5,10,15,20,25,30,35,40,45]),
        'n_neighbors': trial.suggest_categorical('n_neighbors',[3,4,5,6,7,8,9,10]),
        'algorithm': trial.suggest_categorical('algorithm',['auto','ball_tree','kd_tree','brute']),
        "weights": trial.suggest_categorical("weights", ['uniform','distance'])
    } 
    model = KNeighborsClassifier(**params)
    model.fit(xtrain, ytrain)

    valid_preds = model.predict_proba(xvalid)[:,1]
    #test_preds = model.predict(xtest)
    score = roc_auc_score(yvalid, valid_preds)
    return score

# create trial function
def run(my_folds1):   
 
    my_folds1 = my_folds.copy()
    #test1  = test.copy()

    fold=0
    xtrain = my_folds[my_folds1.fold != fold].reset_index(drop=True)
    xvalid = my_folds[my_folds1.fold == fold].reset_index(drop=True)
    #xtest = test1.copy()

    ytrain = xtrain.Survived
    yvalid = xvalid.Survived

    xtrain = xtrain[useful_features]
    xvalid = xvalid[useful_features]

    ## preprocess
    si = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
    xtrain = si.fit_transform(xtrain)
    xvalid = si.transform(xvalid)
    #xtest = si.transform(xtest)

    # scale
    ss = RobustScaler()
    xtrain = ss.fit_transform(xtrain)
    xvalid = ss.transform(xvalid)
    #xtest = ss.transform(xtest)

    xtrain = pd.DataFrame(xtrain, columns=useful_features)
    xvalid = pd.DataFrame(xvalid, columns=useful_features)
    #xtest = pd.DataFrame(xtest, columns=useful_features)
    
#     for col in useful_features:
#         xtrain[col] = np.log1p(xtrain[col])
#         xvalid[col] = np.log1p(xvalid[col])
#         #xtest[col] = np.log1p(xtest[col])
        
    #create optuna study
    study = optuna.create_study(
        direction='maximize',
        study_name='KNeighborsClassifier'
    )

    study.optimize( lambda trial: obj(trial,xtrain,ytrain,xvalid,yvalid),n_trials= 50 ) # it tries 50 different values to find optimal hyperparameter

    print(f"Best Params: {study.best_trial.params}")
    print(f"Best Trial: {study.best_trial.value}")
    
    return study.best_trial.params, study.best_trial.value

#

LEVEL1 ROUND2 KNeighborsClassifier

INTRODUCTION

This is a part of the notebook series "My_Complete_Pipeline_for_any_ML_Competition" where we are building complete pipeline.

📌Link of first notebook of the series https://www.kaggle.com/raj401/my-complete-pipeline-for-any-ml-competition
📌Link of notebook where we have created folds https://www.kaggle.com/raj401/titanic-create-folds

If you like my effort please do UPVOTE👍, it really keeps me motivated.

""

In the TITANIC_Create_Folds notebook we have modified our training set by adding new column named 'fold' and then saved it as TITANIC_folds.csv. In this notebook we will use this modified training set instead of original training set and do hyperparameter tuning of KNeighborsClassifier using OPTUNA. I am providing the link of TITANIC_folds.csv you can just add it to your notebook and you are good to go.
[Make sure you have added it before moving further. If you have TITANIC_Create_Folds notebook you can also add that notebook instead.]
 📌Link of Dataset containing TITANIC_folds.csv https://www.kaggle.com/raj401/titanic-all-datasets

TABLE OF CONTENTS

* [1. IMPORTING LIBRARIES](#1) * [2. READ DATASETS](#2) * [3. PREPROCESSING](#3) * [4. HYPERPARAMETER OPTIMIZATION](#4) * [5. CONCLUSION](#5) * [6. END](#6) #

IMPORTING LIBRARIES
source.cb57cf1f:
#

HYPERPARAMETER OPTIMIZATION

This step is very crucial, here we are using OPTUNA to find optimal hyperparameter.
We have created two functions obj() and run()
run() takes my_folds as input which we have created then it creates a OPTUNA study and feeds this data.
This obj() method is created by OPTUNA which takes xtrain, ytrain, xvalid, yvalid as input and trains the model then make predictions on xvalid and then return roc_auc_score. To know more about OPTUNA you can look at working of OPTUNA from their official doccument.
[If you do not understand anything you can ask me in the comment]
